airport_name: Rome Ciampino G.B. Pastine International Airport

primary: ENAC (Ente Nazionale per l'Aviazione Civile) - Italian Civil Aviation Authority
Universal Weather Business Aviation Destination Guide 2025
secondary: Universal Aviation ground handling services documentation

operational_hours.notes: General aviation flights restricted 21:30-04:00 UTC with limited exceptions. Operating hours 06:00-23:00 local time (LT) for standard operations.

slot_requirements.slot_availability_typical: Slots required for all operations, particularly challenging during peak season (June-September)
slot_requirements.peak_congestion_times: Summer months (June-August), major events, holidays. Daily flight cap discussions ongoing.
slot_requirements.notes: Prior Permission Required (PPR) mandatory. Slots for charter flights with 19+ passengers.

weather_vulnerability.seasonal_risk_periods: Summer thunderstorms (July-August), occasional winter storms with rain
weather_vulnerability.cat_capability: Not equipped with CAT II/III ILS
weather_vulnerability.weather_patterns: Dry-summer subtropical Mediterranean climate (KÃ¶ppen: Csa). Hot, dry summers; mild winters with periodic storms. Thunderstorms possible summer months.
weather_vulnerability.notes: Single runway 15/33 (2,207m) with standard approach capabilities only.

runway_specifications.weight_restrictions: None published, but limited by runway length relative to larger aircraft
runway_specifications.notes: Limited runway length restricts larger aircraft operations. Stage 1 and Stage 2 aircraft generally prohibited.

crew_requirements.minimum_pilot_hours: Per standard Italian and EASA regulations
crew_requirements.notes: Standard EASA certified crew requirements. No special mountain or high-altitude certifications required. Handling personnel mandatory during aircraft exits.

handling_complexity.notes: Handling is mandatory. IS-BAH Stage 1 accredited ground services. Multiple handling agents available. Ground services generally efficient.

congestion_metrics.airspace_complexity: Medium - proximity to Fiumicino and Rome airspace
congestion_metrics.notes: Congestion significant June-September. 42,317 movements recorded in 2022. Traffic often below theoretical capacity but slot management creates apparent congestion.

permits_and_clearances.notes: PPR mandatory for all operations. Landing permits required for some flight types. No diplomatic clearance needed for civilian operations.

noise_restrictions.noise_surcharges: Yes - ENAC-established surcharges for higher noise operations
noise_restrictions.noise_complaints_risk: Medium - proximity to Rome residential areas, though Ciampino is secondary airport
noise_restrictions.noise_abatement_procedures: Initial climb and approach procedures established by ENAC. Voluntary compliance except in adverse weather/safety situations.

infrastructure_reliability.notes: Joint civil/military airport with maintained infrastructure.

security_requirements.enhanced_security_periods: High-alert periods during major events, EU summits
security_requirements.notes: Standard EU security protocols apply. Military presence may require coordination for some operations.

seasonal_factors.winter_deicing_delays_avg: Rare - Mediterranean climate means snow/ice uncommon
seasonal_factors.notes: Summer tourism creates primary congestion. Winter generally mild. Spring and fall typically low congestion.

alternate_airport_proximity.notes: Fiumicino is primary alternate. Different operating hours - general aviation limited 23:00-06:00. Limited by Fiumicino's own congestion during summer.

payment_and_fees.handling_agent_prepayment: Often required for fuel and ground services
payment_and_fees.fuel_payment_terms: Prepayment or post-flight settlement with fuel contract
payment_and_fees.landing_fees: Yes - variable based on aircraft weight and operation type
payment_and_fees.parking_fees: Yes - hourly rates, discounts for longer stays
payment_and_fees.notes: Multiple payment methods available. Aeroporti di Roma maintains published tariff schedule. EU credit cards generally accepted.

operational_advantages: Closer to Rome city center than Fiumicino
summary.crew_considerations: Standard certification sufficient; no special mountain or high-altitude ratings required. Handling personnel must attend aircraft exits.
summary.planning_recommendation: Plan minimum 48 hours advance booking. Contact ground handler early for PPR coordination. Summer travel requires particular attention to slot availability. Consider Fiumicino as backup, though it has different operational hours for general aviation.
